cards.rules_text:
Rilken Forcefield Keeper gets +1/+1 for each enchantment you control.
Sacrifice Rilken Forcefield Keeper: Exile target permanent you control. Return that card to the battlefield under your control at the beginning of the next end step.

When Final Symphony enters, exile another target nonland permanent until Final Symphony leaves the battlefield.
When Final Symphony leaves the battlefield, draw a card.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Living long enough to present my Achievement was all I could ask for.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Lifelink
Whenever Morning's Warden becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, exile target creature that player controls.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“I used to trust the Angels to defend us, but Miss Alia taught me that we must take the fight to the Banished if we want anything to change.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
As long as you have 25 or more life, Alia's Enforcer gets +2/+2 and gains flying.
Whenever an artifact or enchantment you control enters, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“When Miss Alia came to this plane, she asked me to stand against the Banished. With her radiance, I can do anything.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Whenever you draw a card, put a quest counter on Lockdown.
As long as there are three or more quest counters on Lockdown, creatures with power 3 or greater don't untap during their controller's untap steps.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Rilken is the city in the League positioned most perilously. Consequently, it has the best defenses.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Lifelink
Experience [i](Whenever this creature attacks, if it has fewer than three +1/+1 counters on it, put a +1/+1 counter on it.)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Miss Alia believes that its only a matter of time before the Banished storm this world and burn it. We can't let that happen.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Flying
When Benevolent Malach enters, create a 1/1 colorless Construct artifact creature token.
Sacrifice Benevolent Malach: Artifacts you control gain indestructible until end of turn.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Blessed are the cogworkers.”[/i]

cards.rules_text: When Polgek Artisan enters, create an X/X colorless Juggernaut artifact creature token, where X is the number of artifacts and enchantments you control.
Eager Observer gets +1/+1 as long as you control an artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“I don't intend to present an Achievement this year. I'm content to see how others fare, and learn.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Whenever another creature you control enters, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
Whenever Rilken Preserver attacks, you may exile target nonland permanent you control, then return it to the battlefield under your control.

Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, put a quest counter on Align the Astrolabe.
At the beginning of your upkeep, create a 1/1 colorless Construct artifact creature token for each three quest counters on Align the Astrolabe.
When Polgek Restorationist enters, you may return target artifact, enchantment, or planeswalker card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“One moment, I'll make it good as new.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Flying
Experience [i](Whenever this creature attacks, if it has fewer than three +1/+1 counters on it, put a +1/+1 counter on it.)[/i]
Other creatures you control get +1/+1 for each +1/+1 counter on Protector of the League.
cards.flavor_text: [i]The League has long given up on diplomatic attempts with The Banished.[/i]

cards.rules_text: At the beginning of your upkeep, create two 1/1 colorless Construct artifact creature tokens, then you gain life equal to the number of artifacts and enchantments you control.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“Lady Mari gifted me this power, and pointed me in the direction of planes that need help. If it takes an army to destroy the Banished, I will make one.”
—Alia, Bearer of Morning[/i]

cards.rules_text:
When Matron of Machines dies, put a +1/+1 counter on up to one target creature.
{3}{W}, Exile Matron of Machines from your graveyard: Create two 1/1 colorless Construct artifact creature tokens. Activate only as a sorcery.

When Citywide Automation enters, create two 1/1 colorless Construct artifact creature tokens.
{2}{W}{W}, Sacrifice Citywide Automation: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn. Activate only as a sorcery.

Double strike
Experience [i](Whenever this creature attacks, if it has fewer than three +1/+1 counters on it, put a +1/+1 counter on it.)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]For some, the only Achievement that matters is one's own body and skill.[/i]

cards.special_text:
As long as you have more life than each opponent, prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to Alia, Bearer of Morning.
[+1]: You gain 4 life.
[-2]: Exile target tapped creature. Each player draws a card.
[-8]: You get an emblem with “{W}, Pay X life: Exile target creature with power X or less.”

cards.rules_text: When Disassociate enters, exile target creature until Disassociate leaves the battlefield.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“When some mortals sleep, they see beyond the Veil. Most become insomniacs, but others become entranced.”
—Sesilius, Chosen Speaker[/i]

cards.rules_text: Destroy all creatures. Exile all graveyards.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“It gives me no joy to engage in violence like this. But for the sake of the Kelian League, I will do whatever it takes.”
—Shaziel, Archangel[/i]

cards.rules_text: Create a 1/1 colorless Construct artifact creature token. If you control an artifact, create two of those tokens instead.
cards.flavor_text: [i]The Kelian League has automatons for every job, including creating more automatons, allowing its citizens to spend their time focusing on other pursuits.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
At the beginning of combat on your turn, you may attach target Equipment you control to Nina, Master of Arms.
Whenever Nina attacks, the next artifact spell you cast this turn costs {RW}{RW} less to cast. [i](This can reduce the amount of generic mana you pay.)[/i]

Whenever you draw a card, put a quest counter on Seek Perfection.
At the beginning of each end step, if Seek Perfection has four or more quest counters on it, exile target permanent you control, then return it to the battlefield under your control.

You gain 3 life. Choose one —
• You gain 3 life.
• Draw a card.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Even when success is at the tip of your fingers, finding the strength to push forward can feel impossible.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
At the beginning of combat on each opponent's turn, if you control three or more enchantments, choose target creature. Prevent all combat damage that creature would deal this turn.
{2}{W}: You gain 2 life and scry 1.

Choose one —
• Purging Light deals 3 damage to target attacking or blocking creature. If that creature would die this turn, exile it instead.
• Exile target enchantment.
Exile two target permanents you control, then return them to the battlefield under your control.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Ancient texts reveal that Akieva was once even easier to traverse, due to now secret riftways through the Veil.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand. Then you may pay {U}{U}. If you do, copy Resonating Force and you may choose new targets for the copy.

Flash
When Herald of Wisdom enters, you may cast target instant or sorcery card with mana value 4 or less from your graveyard without paying its mana cost. If that spell would be put into your graveyard, exile it instead.
Counter target spell or activated ability. If an activated ability of an artifact was countered this way, put that permanent on the bottom of its owner's library.
cards.flavor_text: [i]A little skullduggery never hurt anyone it wasn't meant to.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Target player draws X cards.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“Hah, it's like you think that technology follows the laws of nature, rather than the other way around.”
— Amira, Grand Inventor[/i]

cards.rules_text: Each artifact you control has all the activated abilities of other artifacts you control.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“A couple of districts will suffer a blackout for half an hour, but my Achievement needs a jump start.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Flash
When Veilborn Meddler enters, counter target spell if its mana value is less than or equal to Veilborn Meddler's power.
Whenever you cast a spell during an opponent's turn, put a +1/+1 counter on Veilborn Meddler.
cards.flavor_text: [i]The latest innovations in troubleshooting from the Iken Company wouldn't receive League approval.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Imitator of Drakes has flying as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it.
{2}{U}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Imitator of Drakes.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Before I was born, the great Drakes that once flew through Akieva's skies left. My greatest Achievement will be to bring them back.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
When Terraformer's Globe enters, draw a card.
{T}: Target land you control becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“There is no such thing as useless land, only insufficiently sculpted land.”
—Merana, Grand Artificer[/i]

cards.rules_text: Put target nonland permanent on top of its owner's library.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Volta ran to the lab, the Banished in full pursuit. If he could just make it to the Clocktower, he could beat them with ease.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
When Artistic Vision enters, create two 1/1 colorless Construct artifact creature tokens.
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, you may tap two untapped artifacts you control. If you do, copy that spell. You may choose new targets for the copies.

Marin Polgek, Academy Heiress has hexproof as long as you control three or more enchantments.
{1{W}U}{WU}: Create a token that's a copy of target enchantment you control.

Eureka! [i](At the beginning of each end step, you get a research counter if you cast a spell this turn. Then if you have eight or more research counters, remove them and create a Masterpiece token of your choice.)[/i]
{T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.

cards.rules_text:
If you would draw a card, you may return an instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand instead.
{U}: Draw three cards.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“If I make it through tonight, everyone is going to hear me out.”[/i]

cards.flavor_text:

—Jessica Turin, Battlemage[/i]

Flash

cards.flavor_text: [i]“At my skill level, there aren't peers, just charlatans who want to steal your research.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:

cards.flavor_text:

Tap seven untapped artifacts you control: Draw three cards.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Director Sah gazed up at the half-built golem. “Get me Volta Hearth. He's the only one who can finish this.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Shuffle any number of cards from your graveyard into your library.
Scry 1, then draw a card.

This spell costs {4} less to cast if a player attacked with four or more creatures this turn.
End the turn.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Volta pulled the tarp off, unveiling the Time Golem. The Banished, along with the rest of the world, suddenly stopped.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]A spell for those who can't invent.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
When Channeler of the Veil enters, create a 1/1 colorless Construct artifact creature token.
Sacrifice another creature: Each opponent loses 1 life.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Collaboration is allowed within the Festival's rules. It's the things I'm collaborating with that aren't.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
[i]Sabotage[/i] — Whenever an opponent or permanent an opponent controls becomes the target of a spell you control, target creature you control can't be blocked this turn.
{B}{B}{B}: Secret Thief gets +3/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“Victory through deceit.”
—Iken Company Motto[/i]

cards.rules_text: Target player reveals their hand. You choose a nonland card from it. That player discards that card. Each player loses 1 life.
cards.flavor_text: [i]There are no worse prisons than those we create for ourselves.[/i]

Flash
Whenever Iken Company Nightwalker deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“When I first turned, I'd hoped that becoming nocturnal would make troubleshooting easier. Unfortunately, engineers don't sleep.”[/i]

Menace
Whenever another creature dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Veilborn Stalker.
cards.flavor_text: [i]The Banished cannot sustain themselves independently on the mortal side of the Veil. A constant stream of life energy is essential for their survival.[/i]

Flash
Deathtouch, lifelink
Whenever Irika, Wielder of Secrets deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {UB}. If you do, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Having power like this and not using it would be a crime. But not the good type of crime. The boring type.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
{1}{B}, Sacrifice a creature or enchantment: Draw a card.
{4}{B}{B}, {T}: Return target creature or enchantment card from your graveyard to the battlefield with a veil counter on it. That permanent gains “If this permanent would leave the battlefield, exile it instead.”

Sacrifice another creature: Veilborn Hunter gains indestructible until end of turn. Tap it.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Once called to this world, Veilborn will do anything they can to stay as long as they can.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
Whenever one or more counters are put on an enchantment you control, you gain 1 life and each opponent loses 1 life.

[i]Sabotage[/i] — Whenever an opponent or permanent an opponent controls becomes the target of a spell you control, return target creature card with mana value 3 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“The Festival rules say I can't damage your Achievement. It says nothing about my undead consorts ‘accidentally' bumping it.”[/i]

cards.rules_text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay 2 life. When you do, proliferate. [i](You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another kind of a counter already there.)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]If there is a cost to the Kelian League's automation, it is out of sight and out of mind. As far as the world knows, there is no price of progress.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Trample
When Sealer of Pacts enters, sacrifice any number of permanents, then draw that many cards.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“A simple exchange. I give you what you want, and you give me the world.”[/i]

cards.rules_text: Target opponent sacrifices a creature. Put a +1/+1 counter on up to one target creature you control.
cards.flavor_text: [i]The Banished live beyond the Veil, in a bleak and ruined reflection of this universe.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Whenever you draw a card, put a quest counter on Fallback Plan.
Remove four quest counters from Fallback Plan and sacrifice it: Search your library for a card, put that card into your hand, then shuffle.

[i]Sabotage[/i] — Whenever an opponent or permanent an opponent controls becomes the target of a spell you control, put a quest counter on Beckon Darkness.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Beckon Darkness has four or more quest counters on it, return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

Surveil 2, then you draw a card and you lose 1 life. [i](To surveil 2, look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them into your graveyard and the rest on top of your library in any order.)[/i]
{2}{B}, Exile Corrupted Knowledge from your graveyard: Each opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor_text: [i]As Volta made his way to the lab for another night of work, he noticed a strange figure stalking him.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
When Monstrous Hunter enters, destroy up to one target creature.
At the beginning of each end step, if a creature died this turn, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Arms beyond number. Spite beyond comprehension.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Draw a card unless an opponent pays 2 life.
cards.special_text:
[+1]: You may sacrifice a permanent. If you do, each opponent sacrifices a permanent that shares a type with it.
[-2]: Put target creature card in a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.
[-8]: You control target player during their next turn. During that turn, that player may cast spells by paying life equal to their mana value rather than pay their mana cost. After that turn, that player takes an extra turn.

cards.rules_text:
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, put a quest counter on Gate to the Beyond.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are three or more quest counters on Gate to the Beyond, you draw a card and you lose 1 life. Then if there are six or more quest counters on it, each opponent loses 2 life.

This spell costs {1}{B} less to cast if it targets a creature with indestructible.
Exile target creature.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“I'm glad your regenerative elixir worked. This year, my Achievement will be presenting an immortal's heart.”
—Irika, Wielder of Secrets[/i]

cards.rules_text: All creatures get -3/-3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor_text: [i]There's always danger in giving an archmage a failing grade.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
This spell costs {1} less to cast for each creature and/or planeswalker card in your graveyard.
Return target creature or planeswalker card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“We have seen the future, and the death of all things, save us and our way of life.”
—Sesilius, Chosen Speaker[/i]

cards.rules_text: Destroy target creature or planeswalker. Draw a card.
cards.flavor_text: [i]People are willing to go to any length to win the Multiplanar Festival of Arts.[/i]

cards.rules_text: You may put a card you own from outside the game into your hand. Add {B}{B}. You may cast only one more spell this turn. Exile Power From Beyond.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“You think of us as monsters, but the truth is you know you'd be the same in our position.”
—Sesilius, to Lady Alia[/i]

cards.rules_text:

• Each opponent sacrifices a creature or planeswalker.
• You draw a card and you lose 1 life.

cards.flavor_text:

—Sesilius, Chosen Speaker[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]“The Iken Company is full of cowards, unwilling to channel true power. You'll want a freelancer like me to help out.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Experience [i](Whenever this creature attacks, if it has fewer than three +1/+1 counters on it, put a +1/+1 counter on it.)[/i]
Whenever Flamecloaked Artisan attacks, exile the top card of your library. If it's a nonland card with mana value less than Flamecloaked Artisan's power, you may cast it this turn, and you may cast it as though it had flash.

Eureka! [i](At the beginning of each end step, you get a research counter if you cast a spell this turn. Then if you have eight or more research counters, remove them and create a Masterpiece token of your choice.)[/i]
Whenever an artifact you control enters, up to two target creatures get +1/+0 and haste until end of turn.

cards.rules_text: Careless Violence deals 2 damage to each creature. If a creature dealt damage this way would die this turn, exile it instead.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“It's hard being the best. Challengers just keep showing up and I just keep getting fined for property damage.”
—Jessica Turin, Battlemage[/i]

cards.rules_text:
When Meteor Harbinger enters, choose one —
• Meteor Harbinger deals 2 damage to each creature.
• Each player sacrifices two lands.
• Meteor Harbinger deals 2 damage to each of two target players or planeswalkers.

Artifact creatures you control have haste.
At the beginning of your upkeep, create a 1/1 colorless Construct artifact creature token. If you control six or more artifacts, create a 6/6 colorless Golem artifact creature token instead. Tokens created this way attack this turn if able.

Flying
When Calamity Dragon enters, it deals 2 damage to each creature you don't control. Whenever a creature dealt damage this way dies this turn, Calamity Dragon deals 2 damage to that creature's controller.

Whenever you tap a land for mana, add an additional one mana of any color.
{8}{G}{G}: Creatures you control get +2/+2 and gain trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“If mortals try to expand their cities and take these woods, I will feed these roots with their flesh.”[/i]

cards.rules_text: If one or more counters would be put on another permanent you control, put that many counters plus one on that permanent instead.
cards.special_text:
If one or more counters would be put on another permanent you control, put that many counters plus one on that permanent instead.
[+1]: Choose up to one target creature you control. When that creature deals combat damage to a player this turn, draw a card.
[-2]: Choose up to two target creatures. Put a +1/+1 counter on each of them.

cards.rules_text:
When Backwoods Cultivator enters, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control.
When Backwoods Cultivator dies, proliferate. [i](You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another kind of a counter already there.)[/i]
{G}{G}, {T}: Create a token that's a copy of target creature you control that entered this turn, except it's an artifact in addition to its other types.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“She looks... so wonderful. If I hadn't made her, I wouldn't have guessed she wasn't flesh.”[/i]

cards.rules_text: Whenever Reclamation Grovesculptor enters or attacks, put a growth counter on target noncreature permanent. It becomes a colorless Forest land and loses all other card types and land types.
cards.flavor_text: [i]She serves Project Reclamation, turning abandoned cities into verdant forests.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
When Flamboyant Inventor enters, create a tapped colorless Powercell artifact token with “{T}: Add {C}.”
At the beginning of each combat, you may have Powercells you control become 2/2 Construct creatures with vigilance in addition to their other types until end of turn.

As long as you control four or more lands, Seeker of Untouched Beauty gets +2/+2 and has trample.
When Seeker of Untouched Beauty dies, you may search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“I remember when I first left the city. How scared I was that I'd miss it. I couldn't have been more wrong.”[/i]

cards.rules_text: When Powercell Engineer enters, create a tapped colorless Powercell artifact token with “{T}: Add {C}.”
cards.flavor_text: [i]“I don't care about the Festival or its awards. Energy is both my means and my ends.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Ravenous Hydra enters with X +1/+1 counters on it.
Whenever Ravenous Hydra deals combat damage, proliferate. [i](You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another kind of a counter already there.)[/i]

Advanced Powercell enters tapped.
{T}: Add one mana of any color.
Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Some members of Project Reclamation take it upon themselves to record all of the fallen and forgotten cities of Akieva before helping the wild overtake them.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Whenever a land you control enters, create two 1/1 colorless Construct artifact creature tokens.
{4}{G}{G}: Put a +1/+1 counter on each artifact creature you control.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Nature and technology aren't opposites, silly. My machines love the outdoors!”[/i]

cards.rules_text: Whenever The Feller of Greatwoods enters or attacks, you may sacrifice two noncreature permanents. For each permanent sacrificed this way, reveal the top five cards of your library. You may put a creature card from among them onto the battlefield and the rest into your graveyard.

Reach
When Kindly Greatwood enters, you gain 5 life and draw a card.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Members of Project Reclamation make pilgrimages to the Greatwoods, who dote on them in return.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Experience [i](Whenever this creature attacks, if it has fewer than three +1/+1 counters on it, put a +1/+1 counter on it.)[/i]
Whenever Primal Ruffian attacks, if it has a +1/+1 counter on it, other creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn. [i](If it had no counters on it when it attacked, this ability does not trigger.)[/i]

Oldgrove Nurturer enters with a +1/+1 counter on it.
{G}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from a creature you control: Create a 1/1 colorless Construct artifact creature token.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“Even the Greatwoods adore small baubles.”
—Acin, the Toymaker[/i]

cards.rules_text: When Reclamation Sage enters, you may destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Project Reclamation mission: To prevent the League from expanding, to stop the Banished from encroaching, and to turn abandoned cities into nature once again.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
When Malicious Growth enters and at the beginning of your upkeep, put two +1/+1 counters on target land you control.
{1}{G}: Target land you control becomes a 0/0 Elemental creature with haste and vigilance until end of turn. It's still a land.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Nature is unwilling to give up more than she has already lost.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
{T}: Add {G}.
{BG}, {T}: Exile target card from a graveyard. If that card is a creature card, put a +1/+1 counter on Dovon, Verdant Experimenter and you gain 1 life.

Enchant land

Enchanted land is an artifact in addition to its other types and has “{T}: Add one mana of any color.”
cards.flavor_text: [i]Even before the Kelian League, all of Akieva's disparate cities barely saw any of its beauties.[/i]

cards.rules_text:

Artifacts you control have “{T}: Add one mana of any color.”

Trample
At the beginning of your end step, if there are two or more +1/+1 counters among creatures you control, return Herald of Might from your graveyard to the battlefield.
You may put a creature or land card from your hand onto the battlefield. Then each opponent may put a permanent card from their hand onto the battlefield. If one does, you may repeat this process.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Project Reclamation isn't always about work. Sometimes it's about being with friends.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Target creature you control gets +X/+X until end of turn. It fights target creature you don't control.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Project Reclamation's mission of protecting the wilds includes purging wayward Banished.[/i]

cards.flavor_text:

— Elyon Virtris, Reclaimer[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]The astrolabe projects star patterns, allowing Akieva's greatest minds to dream of exploring beyond this world.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]It saps away from other power supplies, making even the simplest gadgets freeze.[/i]

Warded Tome doesn't untap during your untap step.
{T}: Draw a card.

Flying
{1}, Sacrifice Gearcraft Observer: Look at target player's hand. Draw a card.

cards.flavor_text:
[i]“That aetherborn put forth three achievements that put our past year of work to shame. Send the Iken company to look into them.”
—Merana, Grand Artificier[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Haste
When Gilded Gearhulk enters, you may destroy target noncreature, nonland permanent.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“For a plane of innovators, they seem very impressed by a Gearhulk. I wonder how much they'd pay for mine.”
—Siraj, Interplanar Thief[/i]

cards.rules_text:
When Junktrawler enters, create a tapped colorless Powercell artifact token with “{T}: Add {C}.”
Tap another untapped artifact you control: Junktrawler gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“We're out of spare parts? Send the retrieval unit to another abandoned city.”
— Merana, Grand Artificer[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Flying, lifelink
When Facsimile of Divinity enters, it deals 4 damage to any target.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“They built her in my image, apparently. I'd be lying if I said I wasn't flattered.”
—Shaziel, Archangel[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Trample
Spells and abilities your opponents control can't cause you to sacrifice Colossal Achievement.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“I choose to solve all of my problems with giant robots.”
—Amira, Grand Inventor[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Manaflux Battery enters tapped.
{T}: Add {C}{C}.
{2}, {T}: Untap each other artifact you control.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“Finally, a new plane that appreciates my talents.”
—Volta Hearth[/i]
[i]Even though the Multiplanar Festival of Arts only happens yearly, it promotes unity and joint focus year round.[/i]
[i]Chesi's dangers come from within, with scheming sabotage and lurking Banished.[/i]
[i]Enori's capital building powers the rest of the city with marble magitech engines.[/i]
[i]The Vitin Academy's doors are open to everyone, provided they can keep up.[/i]
[i]Every laboratory has a personal touch. A cute plant, a warm drink, a soft cot.[/i]
[i]While no one in Akieva is found wanting for food or shelter, some still manage to do better than others.[/i]
[i]Rilken stands, surrounded by malignant wilderness, protected by a shimmering forcefield.[/i]
[i]Some of the abandoned cities outside of the Kelian League lie dormant, with security systems still operational.[/i]
[i]Only the best and the brightest can even test for acceptance at Polgek Academy.[/i]
[i]Dekal's library is twenty stories tall, with six subbasements, containing millions of books and hundreds of labs.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
When Artisan's Genius enters, you may tap three untapped artifacts or other enchantments you control. If you do, draw three cards.
{5}{W}{U}, Exile Artisan's Genius: Return any number of artifact or enchantment cards with different names from your graveyard to your hand.

Choose one or both —
• Counter target spell.
• Exile target permanent you control, then return it to the battlefield under your control.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“I'm sorry, did you honestly think your Achievement was winning this year? Gaze upon mine, and recognize your foolishness.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Flash
When Twisted Speaker enters, return target spell to its owner's hand. That spell's controller loses 2 life.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“I will admit, not all who have held my position dealt well with pressure.”
— Sesilius, Chosen Speaker[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Hexproof
Whenever you cast a spell with mana value 5 or greater, each opponent discards a card and loses 3 life.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Some mages apply the lessons they learn from the Banished in ways that jeopardize their corporeal form.[/i]

cards.rules_text: [i]Sabotage[/i] — Whenever an opponent or permanent an opponent controls becomes the target of a spell you control, Iken Troubleshooter deals 2 damage to each opponent.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“My boss doesn't like competition.”[/i]

cards.rules_text: Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, Omegalomania deals 2 damage to any target. Whenever a permanent you don't control dealt damage this way dies this turn, return it to the battlefield tapped under your control.
Whenever Seeker of Battle attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control. Those creatures gain trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor_text: [i]For years, she showed off her might in the cities. Now she finds worthy opponents in the wilds.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
{5}{G}{W}, Exile Claim for Civilization from your graveyard: Create a 6/6 colorless Golem artifact creature token. Activate only as a sorcery.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may reveal a creature card from your hand. If you do, create a token that's a copy of it, except it's 1/1 and is an artifact in addition to its other types.

When Deliver from Dilapidation enters, you may sacrifice any number of enchantments. Whenever you sacrifice an enchantment this way, destroy target creature.
At the beginning of your upkeep, return target enchantment card with mana value 5 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.

When Embrace the Veil enters, you may exile target nonland permanent you don't control until Embrace the Veil leaves the battlefield.
Whenever you cast a spell with mana value 5 or greater, you may put a card exiled with Embrace the Veil into its owner's graveyard and return Embrace the Veil to its owner's hand.

!changed

I don't love this design, probably needs more iteration

cards.flavor_text: [i]“Stable chronology is overrated!”[/i]
